verses.roman:
manyunā kṣubhitaḥ śrīmān
samudra iva parvaṇi
jātyāruṇākṣo 'ti-ruṣā
nyarbudaṁ glaham ādade

synonyms: manyunā—by anger; kṣubhitaḥ—agitated; śrī-mān—possessing beauty, or the beautiful goddess of fortune; samudraḥ—the ocean; iva—like; parvaṇi—on the full-moon day; jātyā—by nature; aruṇa—reddish; akṣaḥ—whose eyes; ati—extreme; ruṣā—with anger; nyarbudam—of one hundred million; glaham—a wager; ādade—accepted.
translation: Shaking with anger like the ocean on the full-moon day, handsome Lord Balarāma, His naturally reddish eyes even redder in His fury, accepted a wager of one hundred million gold coins.
